translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sal-flower Similes

analyzed: citaka nibbāpaka thera apadāna  dayhamāne sarīramhi

translated: “When the body of the Great Sage Vessabhu🔽was burning,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the scented water.
How welcome it was for me
…🔽I have done what had to be done.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā citakanibbāpako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā citakanibbāpakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what had to be done.”🔽Thus the elder Citakanibbāpaka recited these verses.
The Elder Citakanibbāpaka’s Birth Story, the third.
